metadata.title: Lightweight Lua
metadata.author: Limrix
metadata.description:
# Lightweight Lua A library of several useful functions. Aims to make lua scripting less of a pain. Categories: Logging, Crew, Geometry, Point, Angle, Events, Control Flow
### Lightweight 3D A simplistic 3d rendering library, lw3. This is what Omen in FFFTL uses.
### UI Library Do all sorts of things with a whole bunch of visual elements. Used in Grimdark Expy. Includes: Buttons, Scroll bars, text boxes, and more!
### Stable Time A library that takes care of normalizing onTick logic across all fram
### Event Broadcaster Informs you of when things happen that are annoying to track. Supports: Crew death animation started, crew death animation finished, crew cloned, hangar entered, player variables loaded.
### Meta and Player Variable Structure Gives an object-oriented way of registering persistent variables. This keeps track of how many of a kind of object are stored, and what properties those objects have.
### Safe Script A wrapper around calls to script that allows you to change or remove the callback. Required for runtime hotswapping of code so that you can deregister the previous iteration.
### Status Effects Library Apply statuses to crew, such as bleed, corruption, and confusion. Used in Grimdark Expy.
### Keybinds Gives an easy interface for registering key press events, including combinations of modifier keys.
### XML Generation Lua scripts for creating the xml required for animations and lab upgrades. Leave suggestions if you think I should add something here.
### Self-Indexing List For when you want members to implicitly know their index.
### Doubly Linked List A basic doubly linked list implementation.
### Crew Change Observers Register to know when your ship's crew changes
### Teleport Status Observers Register to know if any crew is teleporting
### Blood Not a library, this is a toggleable feature that adds crew-specific bloodstains on death.
### Clone Orders This is another toggleable feature, this time making your crew go do something when they clone in instead of standing there.
